Key Arguments: The legislation will lead to excessive censorship and stifle the sharing of ideas.
Legal uncertainty for online platforms will force them to censor controversial content.
Historically, many ideas initially considered false were later proven true.
A small group of people should not have the power to decide what is misinformation.
Main Themes: Concerns about centralized control and censorship
Notable Quotes: It is far better to let people share their beliefs, respectfully disagree, debate on issues, and make up their own minds about matters.

This draft bill, however, will effectively shut down the sharing of many ideas and create so much legal uncertainty for online platforms that they will be forced to censor anything which might be considered controversial.
Throughout human history, hotly contested or even nearly universally disbelieved ideas have turned out, years later, to be the truth.
